title.narrative: U.S.-Indo-Pacific Standards and Technology Cooperation Program (STCP), through American National Standards Institute

description.narrative: USTDA funding is supporting the U.S.-Indo-Pacific Standards and Technology Cooperation Program (STCP), a series of 12 separate and distinct standards-focused workshops to be held in different countries throughout the Indo-Pacific region. The STCP is designed to support the Indo-Pacific Strategy by facilitating engagement between U.S. and Indo-Pacific industry and government representatives to ensure that decision-makers who develop and implement standards, testing protocols, and regulatory procedures in the region are informed of internationally accepted industry-led standards.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - ASEAN 5G Ecosystem RTM Series, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: The 5G Ecosystem Reverse Trade Mission Series consists of three separate missions designed to familiarize decision makers from Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam with U.S. technologies and use cases for 5G wireless networks. The missions will build awareness of the potential applications and enabling regulatory environment that can accelerate 5G rollout and the enhanced security implications. The RTM delegations will travel to up to three cities in the United States for meetings with public and private sector representatives and relevant site visits.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Central America Digital Connectivity Workshop Training Series, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Central America Digital Connectivity Workshop Training Series consists of ten online workshops focused on U.S. technologies and best practices in the ICT sector that support priority ICT infrastructure projects in Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Workshop Series - United States-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshop Series Phase II, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: USTDA funding would support a series of four (4) workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity, and operational training to key officials from civil aviation authorities, airlines, air navigation providers, and/or individual airport operators in Southeast Asia and Pacific Islands. The U.S.-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshops Series Phase II would serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Southeast Asian and Pacific Island counterparts to collaborate on best practices, standards, and policy development for the region's aviation industry. USTDA funding is enabling the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to deliver technical content and program support for the USTDA-funded U.S.-Southeast Asia Aviation Cooperation Program Workshop Series Phase II. The workshops aim to facilitate engagement on key topics in aviation between government and industry representatives from the United States, Southeast Asia, and the Pacific Islands.

title.narrative: Workshop Series - Caribbean Digital Infrastructure Resilience and Connectivity Workshop Series, through Davis Management Group

description.narrative: The Caribbean Digital Infrastructure Resilience and Connectivity Workshop Series consists of five online workshops focused on U.S. technologies and best practices that support ICT infrastructure projects in Belize, Dominica, Grenada, Guyana, Jamaica, Saint Lucia, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, and Suriname.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Mawingu Networks Expansion, through Dalberg Global Development Advisors

description.narrative: This grant partially funds a feasibility study for Mawingu Networks Limited to support expansion of its network throughout rural and underserved areas in Kenya and into Uganda and Rwanda to increase internet access and rural connectivity throughout East Africa.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Indo-Pacific Healthcare Technologies Reverse Trade Mission Series, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) series will bring delegates from India, Thailand, and Vietnam to the United States to familiarize them with state-of-the-art U.S. technologies, services, and best practices to improve the safety, efficiency, and sustainability of healthcare infrastructure. The primary focus for the India and Thailand RTMs would be on commercial opportunities for healthcare technologies, while the primary focus area of the Vietnam RTM would be on medical device regulations and management systems.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Central Asia Advanced Technologies for Methane Abatement Reverse Trade Mission, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: The Central Asia Advanced Technologies for Methane Abatement Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) is designed to showcase advanced U.S. technologies, services, and best practices for methane abatement in the oil and gas sector.
